meanings.definition: One who assigns numbers to things.
meanings.sent1: The numberer labeled each book with a different number.
meanings.sent2: The numberer at the library was responsible for organizing the books.
meanings.sent3: The numberer accidentally labeled the chairs instead of the books.
meanings.sent4: She was like a human numberer, bringing order to the chaos of the files.
meanings.sent5: The diligent numberer made sure every item had a clear identification.

meanings.definition: A device or tool used for numbering items.
meanings.sent1: The small numberer stamped the date on each document.
meanings.sent2: The numberer was essential for keeping track of inventory.
meanings.sent3: The numberer machine hummed as it marked each page.
meanings.sent4: The numberer clicked rhythmically, adding a sense of order to the process.
meanings.sent5: The electronic numberer was a time-saving tool for the busy office.

meanings.definition: To assign a number to something.
meanings.sent1: She would numberer each page of the report before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to numberer their test papers.
meanings.sent3: He decided to numberer the boxes in rainbow order for fun.
meanings.sent4: The artist would numberer each painting in the series with care.
meanings.sent5: It was important to numberer the pages correctly to avoid confusion.
